page.title: 17SPECIAL SCHOOL IN ENCHMARSH
page.content: The 17th century Malt House,Enchmarsh was converted in 1978 into a home for young people with special needs. The family consists of grandmother,parents who are qualified teachers,and 3 adopted children attending local schools. Also 6 handicapped young adults are here on a training course who,with the help of 2 qualified care assistants,are learning the skills of personal and social life,continuing their education and are fully involved in the care of animals,house & garden. Daily responsibility for the cow,goats pony,poultry,etc. provide relevant learning situations as do the prepara- tion and preservation of home produce e.g.vegetables,meat,eggs,honey,jam, wine,home-ground flour and milk products. Traditional crafts are experienced and leisure activities enjoyed.
